author: Kim Ji-hye
title: Novartis' Leqvio tackles adherence challenges with simpler treatment for heart patients
text: Recent guidelines in Korea for high-risk atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) patients have shifted, recommending a substantial reduction in low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) levels from 70 mg/dL to below 55 mg/dL—an ambitious target that reflects the growing consensus that "the lower, the better" for heart disease prevention. But even with the most advanced statin therapies, many patients are still falling short. “Despite high doses of oral treatments, one-third of patients can’t reach the LDL-C target of 70 ( mg/dL),” said Professor Kim Byeong-keuk of cardiology at Severance Hospital. “With the new target of 55 ( mg/dL), more than 40 percent could still miss the mark.” Professor Kim spoke at an open campus program hosted by Novartis Korea on Thursday, where he offered an overview of Leqvio (ingredient: inclisiran), a first-in-class small interfering RNA (siRNA) treatment that gained regulatory approval in Korea this past June. However, Kim stated that the issue of achieving LDL-C targets isn't just about the drugs; it's about patient adherence. “When patients stick to their treatment plans, their outcomes improve dramatically,” Kim explained. “But as regimens become more complicated, adherence falls off. Multiple medications, large pills, and frequent doses all contribute to patients abandoning their treatments.” Adherence isn’t just a nice-to-have; it’s a necessity—especially for older patients battling atherosclerosis. Polypharmacy is a growing issue, and as treatment intensifies, so does the challenge of getting patients to stick with it, particularly the elderly, who face additional hurdles in remembering their medications. In Korea, the problem is compounded by a rising number of single-person households, where older adult patients are often left to manage their treatment alone. "Even with reminders and nurse consultations, compliance remains stubbornly low," Kim noted. For chronic conditions that involve multiple risk factors, achieving full control is even harder. According to Kim, that’s why improving adherence is just as critical as developing new medications. “The fewer times patients have to take their medication, the better,” he said. Unlike oral medications, which require frequent doses, Leqvio offers a far simpler regimen—just two injections in the first year, then one every six months after that. For patients, this means near-perfect compliance. "It’s essentially a guaranteed compliance rate," Kim said. "We’re not just prescribing a drug; we’re delivering a treatment that healthcare providers can ensure was given as intended." In a world where even a two-week regimen is prone to missed doses, Kim said Leqvio's biannual injections could be a potential game-changer. When compared to the more frequent dosing required by anti-PCSK9 monoclonal antibodies (mAbs), siRNAs like Leqvio offer a much more favorable adherence profile. "An injection every six months offers almost perfect adherence," Kim said. In Korea, where these treatments are administered directly in healthcare settings, Kim believes adherence could "realistically reach 100 percent." This, he argued, isn't just a minor improvement—it's a significant shift in how we approach cardiovascular care. "It's essentially a new treatment strategy," he said. The phase 3 ORION clinical trials—ORION-9, ORION-10, and ORION-11—showed that Leqvio significantly reduced LDL-C levels in patients with ASCVD or equivalent risk, and heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HeFH). By Day 510, Leqvio reduced LDL-C by 47.9 percent, 52.3 percent, and 49.9 percent in treatment groups compared to placebo (P<0.001). The more recent ORION-18 trial, conducted with Asian collaborators including Korea, showed similar results. Participants received an injection every three months initially, followed by one every six months. 57.2 percent of participants experienced steady LDL-C reduction, with some exceeding 60 mg/dL. Follow-up results showed that the 50 percent reduction in LDL-C persisted for up to six years, even in those who resumed treatment after a placebo period. For countries like Korea, where insurance typically covers biannual treatments, Kim emphasized that Leqvio represents an ideal solution. "Over 80 percent of patients who come for outpatient visits only need to come twice a year," Kim noted. However, despite the promising results, Korea’s insurance coverage for Leqvio is lagging behind. "We haven’t even started discussions on insurance coverage," Kim said. "It’s disappointing, especially since this isn’t just about the drug itself. This treatment could define the future of cardiovascular care." Related articles [jkim404@docdocdoc.co.kr](mailto:jkim404@docdocdoc.co.kr)

author: repubblica.it
title: Previsioni meteo, ancora piogge, weekend più soleggiato e con massime in aumento di 6-7°C - la Repubblica
text:
Rovesci molto frequenti e anche forti stanno colpendo buona parte del Paese da domenica scorsa; almeno fino al 20 maggio la situazione non cambierà in modo sostanziale.
Lorenzo Tedici, meteorologo del sito www.iLMeteo.it, conferma altri 10 giorni di instabilità diffusa, ma ci lascia una timida speranza per il weekend della Festa della Mamma. Sia sabato sia domenica il tempo sarà più soleggiato con massime fino a 7°C più alte rispetto ai valori simili-autunnali degli ultimi giorni piovosi.
Ancora piogge Prima del weekend avremo, invece, ancora maltempo: nelle prossime ore sono previsti acquazzoni soprattutto tra Alpi e Prealpi, al Nord-Est e tra Toscana, Umbria e Marche; andrà meglio a sud di una linea immaginaria Viterbo-Teramo: il meridione godrà, infatti, ancora di una giornata in prevalenza stabile.
Venerdì, invece, cambierà tutto anche al Sud con l’arrivo di una perturbazione che porterà piogge sparse e locali temporali. Le temperature massime saranno perlopiù stazionarie su valori compresi in pianura tra i 19°C di buona parte del Nord, i 22-23°C della Liguria e del Centro-Sud, mentre in Sicilia, nonostante alcuni acquazzoni, continueremo a toccare punte di 26-27°C.
Weekend
Come detto, il weekend sarà più soleggiato e più caldo ed avremo un aumento termico anche di 7°C rispetto ai giorni precedenti. Il sole però non dominerà incontrastato: domenica 11 maggio ci saranno frequenti temporali specie nel pomeriggio su tutta la fascia appenninica, sulle Alpi e sulle Prealpi, ma qualche scroscio d’acqua potrebbe invadere anche le pianure adiacenti. Si starà meglio al mare.
Nuova settimana instabile Anche la nuova settimana sarà instabile quasi ovunque: anzi, da lunedì è previsto un graduale peggioramento ad iniziare dal Sud con una perturbazione magrebina: occhi puntati, poi, ancora verso il nord africa tra mercoledì e giovedì, quando è prevista la formazione di un altro ciclone molto potente in Algeria che potrebbe portare nubifragi sulle regioni meridionali, con caratteristiche tropicali, diluvi e colpi di vento.
Al momento, questo ciclone simil-tropicale è previsto tra una settimana esatta, per il 15 maggio: almeno fino alla fine della seconda decade il tempo non si stabilizzerà.
NEL DETTAGLIO Giovedì 8. Al Nord: instabile con rovesci e schiarite. Al Centro: alternanza di piogge e schiarite. Al Sud: variabile.
Venerdì 9. Al Nord: rovesci e schiarite anche ampie. Al Centro: soleggiato. Al Sud: peggioramento con piogge e rovesci.
Sabato 10. Al Nord: soleggiato e più caldo. Al Centro: soleggiato e più caldo. Al Sud: soleggiato e più caldo.
Tendenza: domenica con sole e rovesci, peggiora da lunedì.
Leggi i commenti I commenti dei lettori

author: Chanelle Georgina
title: Chinese zodiac for 2024 is the year of the dragon - what this could mean for your sign | Express.co.uk
text:
2024 is the year of the dragon (Image: Getty) 2024 is a time for renewal, inspiration and innovation, meaning it's a great time to start new projects, whatever they may be.
The year of the Wood Dragon is said to be a "favourable year for building a house or investing in real estate" for many.
The Chinese Zodiac did, however, make clear that each sign is uniquely influenced by the energy of the Wood Dragon.
Whether there is an extra sprinkle of good luck or obstructive energy that impedes positive developments, your thoughts, feelings and behaviours have the most impact on how you receive 2024.
While the energetic forces influence how 2024 is likely to go, the way you choose to react to them is up to you.
READ MORE... Astrologer shares which zodiac sign is the 'funniest' with an infectious humour
Rats will need to be diplomatic in 2024 (Image: Getty) How the Wood Dragon affects each sign in 2024 Rat years
1948 1960 1972 1984 1996 2008 2020 Aided by the lucky Jin Kui Star, Rats should expect financial prosperity in the form of steady cashflow.
They have been cautioned, however, that they must remain tactful when dealing with others to avoid any misunderstandings that could be heightened by the Tian Xiong star.
Don't miss...
Astrologer shares which zodiac sign is the 'funniest' with an infectious humour [INSIGHT]
Astrologer shares biggest piece of advice to each zodiac signs [EXPERT]
Astrologer shares the four 'luckiest' zodiac signs - they are naturally lucky [LATEST]
The Ox will mostly have a peaceful year (Image: Getty) Become an Express Premium member Support fearless journalism Read The Daily Express online, advert free Get super-fast page loading Start 30-day
FREE trial
Ox years
1949 1961 1973 1985 1997 2009 2021 There may be new opportunities within their career, which may come about through useful contacts.
This new job opportunity is likely to bring with it a little injection of more cash flow.
Singles will be especially favoured in 2024 as the Tian star will bless them with mental clarity and a peaceful outlook.
Trending Tiger years
1950 1962 1974 1986 1998 2010 2022 The predictions for the Tiger in 2024 aren't too favourable, as sorrow could creep into their romantic lives and so could emotional instability.
Not only that, the Tiger will need to be more self-control to overcome unhealthy habits. There is a glimpse of hope, however, in financial pursuits and exploring new opportunities.
Rabbit years
1951 1963 1975 1999 2023 Minor challenges in the workplace are best looked at as a chance for growth and improvement.
While some Rabbits may feel lonely during 2024, due to the star Mo Yue, there can be touches of romance and happiness spread throughout the year.
Dragon years
1952 1964 1976 1988 2000 2012 2024 Finishing off with the Dragon, just because it's your year in name, it doesn't mean it's the best year for you personally.
There could be obstacles, bad luck, and challenges entering your life, but you can still create stability and harmony if you are calm, diplomatic, and generous.

author: Contact Information Jeff Mathews Production Manager Your Online Publicist Contact
title: Take the Powerful, Realistic Journey of War in “My Brother's Keeper: Poems of the Vietnam War by Marine Cpl. Rod Padilla”
text:
Take the Powerful, Realistic Journey of War in “My Brother’s Keeper: Poems of the Vietnam War by Marine Cpl. Rod Padilla”
Esteemed author and veteran Rodwick Padilla invites you to a captivating exploration of humanity in the face of conflict.
Having endured the trials of war and emerged a beacon of Strength and bravery, Rodwick Padilla draws from the depths of his experience as a Marine Corporal in the Vietnam War. His insights into the daunting realities of life on the battlefield and his reflections on his interactions with the local populace offer readers a profound understanding of his lived experiences. These experiences have inspired the stirring verses in Padilla’s poetry collection, a deeply personal narrative that underscores the stark realities of war.
The book, “My Brother’s Keeper: Poems of the Vietnam War by Marine Cpl. Rod Padilla,” unfolds a poignant narrative that examines the underbelly of war. As readers traverse through the verses, they will encounter stories of camaraderie, sacrifice, and the tragic loss of innocence, seen through the eyes of the soldiers and the locals they interacted with. Padilla’s prose cuts through the superficial, presenting a world where the hope of escape is juxtaposed with harsh confrontations of grim reality, often culminating in tragic events.
The anthology serves a purpose beyond sharing Padilla’s own experiences; it aims to provide comfort and understanding to those who have encountered similar situations, and those who have been muted by the traumas of war. The raw, emotional depth of his poems is a testament to this. Padilla hopes his book will provide solace to readers, and that the recollection of his fallen comrades will bring about a sense of closure.
Experience the unflinching truth of war through the lens of a seasoned veteran in “My Brother’s Keeper: Poems of the Vietnam War by Marine Cpl. Rod Padilla.” Rodwick Padilla offers a gritty, uncompromising perspective on the stark realities of conflict, a narrative that transcends the battlefield and resonates with the human experience. To immerse yourself in this moving chronicle, visit our website
www.rodwickpadilla.com to secure a copy of this gripping collection of poems. Walk alongside Padilla as he navigates through memories of conflict and camaraderie, casting a new light on the price of freedom and sacrifice.
“My Brother’s Keeper”
Author: Rod Padilla
Publisher : Your Online Publicist
Language : English
Paperback : 84 pages
ISBN-10 : 163448701X
ISBN-13 : 978-1634487016
ASIN : B00T8K5292
Language : English
File size : 851 KB
About the Author
Rod Padilla lives in Montara, California with his wife and family. He recently retired from a long career in youth education, and now spends much of his time in veteran affairs and community service. His hobby is rebuilding vintage muscle cars.

author: MENAFN
title: Ministry Marks International Plastic Bag Free Day With Various Activities
text:
( MENAFN - The Peninsula) QNA
Doha, Qatar: The Ministry of Municipality celebrated the International Plastic Bag Free Day, which falls on July 3 of every year, by organizing several awareness events for the public, and visitors to commercial malls.
The activities affirmed the need to reduce single-use plastic bags and replace them with environmentally friendly cloth bags to preserve and sustain the environment and achieve the Qatar National Vision 2030 (QNV 2030).
In this regard, awareness publications and environmentally friendly bags were distributed to the public, introducing the ministry's efforts to reduce the use of plastic bags and introducing ministerial decision No. 143 of 2022 regarding controls on the use of plastic bags and Public Hygiene Law No. 18 of 2017, amended by Law No. 6 of 2023, in addition to explaining the solid waste sorting program from the source and introducing Ministerial Decision No. 170 of 2021 regarding it, as well as various entertainment and educational activities for children and the public.

author: F_400987
title: La Chine soutient les personnes déplacées au Soudan du Sud
text: - Plus La Chine soutient les personnes déplacées au Soudan du Sud Le Soudan du Sud a indiqué jeudi que les camions transportant l'aide humanitaire donnée par la Chine pour soutenir les réfugiés et les rapatriés déplacés du Soudan ont commencé à arriver à Juba, capitale du Soudan du Sud. Le ministre des Affaires humanitaires et de la Gestion des catastrophes, Albino Akol Atak, a déclaré que six camions transportant un total de 26.145 feuilles de plastique étaient arrivés à Juba pour aider les rapatriés et les réfugiés. "Il s'agit d'un don généreux du gouvernement chinois au peuple du Soudan du Sud et d'un résultat de notre engagement avec la communauté internationale et les donateurs pour qu'ils aident le gouvernement et soutiennent les efforts du gouvernement dans ses réponses à l'afflux de réfugiés et de rapatriés qui sont venus à la suite du conflit au Soudan", a déclaré M. Akol à la presse à Juba. Plus de 460.000 personnes ont déjà été déplacées vers le Soudan du Sud à la suite du conflit soudanais et ont un besoin urgent d'abris, de nourriture et de médicaments dans les centres de transit et dans leur destination finale, a-t-il déclaré. M. Akol a déclaré que le don de la Chine serait utilisé pour abriter les rapatriés et les réfugiés dans les sites de transit et les destinations finales. Il y aura un autre soutien du gouvernement chinois pour les personnes déplacées totalisant 1,4 million de dollars américains, qui sera livré avant la fin du mois de janvier 2024, a-t-il noté.
